title: ELIXIR Training self-certification
description: Training from ELIXIR should follow certain minimal standards. By evaluating your training using these standards you can self-certify your training. Please answer the following questions to get a badge.

questions.prompt: Does the resource have all the minimal descriptors of the BioSchemas profile? For more information about BioSchemas see https://bioschemas.org

sections.title: FAIR principles
sections.description: Are the following FAIR Training recommendations “principles”/aspects addressed by the training material

questions.prompt: Does your training material have a url?
Is there a short overview of the material?
Does the material have an identifier?
Have the training materials been successfully scraped by TeSS?
Is the Training Event registered in TeSS?
What interoperable formats have you used for the materials?

sections.title: Pedagogic base
sections.description: Does the material follow good pedagogical principles.

questions.prompt: Is the level that the learners’ knowledge will reach on the topic specified? For a definition of the novice, intermediate and advanced levels, please refer to these relevant resources: Bioinformatic Mastery Rubric, with a corresponding introduction and a professional guide, and the ELIXIR Train-the-Trainer course
Is the target audience explicitly written/defined?

Are prerequisites described? These include both technical, such as required software/hardware and respective skills, and training-related, such as prior experience and knowledge. Ideally, all knowledge- and skill-related prerequisites should be defined using actionable verbs (i.e. Bloom’s).
Are the learning outcomes explicitly written/defined, e.g., is there such a section included in the description?
Are learning outcomes written using actionable verbs (i.e. Bloom’s)?

sections.title: ELIXIR specific
sections.description: Does the material follow ELIXIR standards.

questions.prompt: Will the Training Event adopt the ELIXIR feedback questionnaires (both short-term and long-term)? Note: Please do not share any link to the survey results.
Is the training event organised by one or more ELIXIR Nodes?
Will the course include at least one instructor who has attended a formal pedagogical course (such as the ELIXIR TtT course)?
Does the course abide by the ELIXIR Code of Conduct?

Are participants informed of any collected usage data (e.g. names or emails of participants, images, videos if recorded, or pictures were taken)? Note: data collection should be compliant with the GDPR rules, based on the local regulations of the organising Institution
